case_vignette: An 8-year-old girl is brought into your clinic with a 5 day history of decreased oral intake, body aches and lymphadenopathy. She has no significant medical history. Upon further questioning you find that the patient frequently plays outside, where she enjoys chasing the neighborhood cats and dogs. She has had no recent sick contacts or travel to foreign countries. The patients vital signs are: temperature 100.4F, HR 80, BP 105/75 and RR 15. Physical exam is significant for a 1-cm erythematous and tender lymph node in the right posterior cervical area (Figure 1). There is a nearly healed scratch in the right occipital region.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been eating less, feeling body aches, and have some swollen glands.
Have you had any fever or chills?
I've had a fever.
Have you had any recent travel history or contact with someone who has been sick?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been around anyone sick.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I've been eating less.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
I didn't mention anything about changes in my sleep or energy levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I don't have a significant medical history, so no changes in medication or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels or work schedule?
I'm just a child; I haven't mentioned anything about stress or work.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or genetic background?
My family history and genetic background haven't changed.
Final Diagnosis: Influenza.

trial_0.summarized_mcq: The most likely diagnosis for this patient is Bartonella henselae infection.
